Weightlifting, also called Olympic-style weightlifting, or Olympic weightlifting, is an 
athletic discipline in the modern Olympic programme in which the athlete 
attempts a maximum-weight single lift of a barbell loaded with weight plates. The 
two competition lifts in order are the snatch and the clean and jerk. ... The sport is 
controlled by the International Weightlifting Federation (IWF).
